intro: Dudleya lagunensis, commonly known as the Santa Barbara Dudleya, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. It is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
